definition.name: NXsource
definition.doc: The neutron or x-ray storage ring/facility.

field.name: distance
field.doc: Effective distance from sample Distance as seen by radiation from sample. This number should be negative to signify that it is upstream of the sample.

field.name: name
field.doc: Name of source

attribute.name: short_name
attribute.doc: short name for source, perhaps the acronym

field.name: type
field.doc: type of radiation source (pick one from the enumerated list and spell exactly)

field.name: probe
field.doc: type of radiation probe (pick one from the enumerated list and spell exactly)

field.name: power
field.doc: Source power

field.name: emittance_x
field.doc: Source emittance (nm-rad) in X (horizontal) direction.

field.name: emittance_y
field.doc: Source emittance (nm-rad) in Y (horizontal) direction.

field.name: sigma_x
field.doc: particle beam size in x

field.name: sigma_y
field.doc: particle beam size in y

field.name: flux
field.doc: Source intensity/area (example: s-1 cm-2)

field.name: energy
field.doc: Source energy. For storage rings, this would be the particle beam energy. For X-ray tubes, this would be the excitation voltage.

field.name: current
field.doc: Accelerator, X-ray tube, or storage ring current

field.name: voltage
field.doc: Accelerator voltage

field.name: frequency
field.doc: Frequency of pulsed source

field.name: period
field.doc: Period of pulsed source

field.name: target_material
field.doc: Pulsed source target material

group.name: notes
group.doc: any source/facility related messages/events that occurred during the experiment

group.name: bunch_pattern
group.doc: For storage rings, description of the bunch pattern. This is useful to describe irregular bunch patterns.

field.name: title
field.doc: name of the bunch pattern

field.name: number_of_bunches
field.doc: For storage rings, the number of bunches in use.

field.name: bunch_length
field.doc: For storage rings, temporal length of the bunch

field.name: bunch_distance
field.doc: For storage rings, time between bunches

field.name: pulse_width
field.doc: temporal width of source pulse

field.name: mode
field.doc: source operating mode

field.name: top_up
field.doc: Is the synchrotron operating in top_up mode?

field.name: last_fill
field.doc: For storage rings, the current at the end of the most recent injection.

attribute.name: time
attribute.doc: date and time of the most recent injection.

field.name: photon_energy
field.doc: The center photon energy of the source, before it is monochromatized or converted

field.name: center_wavelength
field.doc: The center wavelength of the source, before it is monochromatized or converted

field.name: pulse_energy
field.doc: For pulsed sources, the energy of a single pulse

field.name: peak_power
field.doc: For pulsed sources, the pulse energy divided by the pulse duration

field.name: bunch_number_start
field.doc: Some facilities tag each bunch. First bunch of the measurement

field.name: bunch_number_end
field.doc: Last bunch of the measurement

group.name: geometry
group.deprecated: Use the field `depends_on` and :ref:`NXtransformations` to position the source and NXoff_geometry to describe its shape instead

group.doc: This group describes the shape of the beam line component

group.name: distribution
group.doc: The wavelength or energy distribution of the source

attribute.name: default
attribute.doc:
.. index:: plotting
Declares which child group contains a path leading to a :ref:`NXdata` group.
It is recommended (as of NIAC2014) to use this attribute to help define the path to the default dataset to be plotted. See https://www.nexusformat.org/2014_How_to_find_default_data.html for a summary of the discussion.

field.name: depends_on
field.doc:
NeXus positions components by applying a set of translations and rotations to apply to the component starting from 0, 0, 0. The order of these operations is critical and forms what NeXus calls a dependency chain. The depends_on field defines the path to the top most operation of the dependency chain or the string "." if located in the origin. Usually these operations are stored in a NXtransformations group. But NeXus allows them to be stored anywhere.
The reference point of the source plane is its center in the x and y axis. The source is considered infinitely thin in the z axis.
.. image:: source/source.png :width: 40%

group.doc: This is the group recommended for holding the chain of translation and rotation operations necessary to position the component within the instrument. The dependency chain may however traverse similar groups in other component groups.
